name: Duck Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a "perfectly" appointed or professionally decorated inn, but that's why we chose it. We wanted a relaxing weekend away from it all with a view of the ocean. The property is beautiful and peacefully located far off the beaten path. It's on one of the higher points of the island with wide, distant views of ocean and the lighthouse. The 2nd floor maximizes the view. The house decor is shabby-sheik...as if put together from yard sale finds...but is so incredibly warm and comfortable...no worries about putting your cup of coffee down! The quirky duck theme adds a sense of humor and guests are so well cared for. We stayed over Memorial Day Weekend 2012 for two nights, were pampered to an extreme and left entirely relaxed. We loved the bird feeder frenzy every morning, the rabbits in the yard & breakfasts to die for. We considered returning this Memorial Weekend (which is what reminded me to finally write this review), but we're headed to NYC.
reviews.title: Relaxing and charming...

reviews.text: Elise was warm and welcoming. Her place is cosy, breakfast was wonderful. We walked to the beach, she allowed us to bring our (small) dog and spoiled her rotten! Showers were plenty hot, hot-tub small and private, lovely fireplace. Low-key place from which to enjoy the island. If you want a ton of amenities, shopping, etc.....don't go to Aquinnah. If you want serene, beautiful landscapes, and the company of those respectful of what nature has to share, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Just beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was perhaps our best ever experience of an Inn. The Duck Inn is a beautiful historic building set among fields, woods, and dry stone walls, with wonderful views of the ocean and lighthouse. The interior, with passive solar design, is charmingly furnished with vintage pieces that were selected with love and often humor. And yes, it's clean, notwithstanding the third review below! Elyse, the innkeeper, gave us a warm, generous welcome and quickly became a friend. Her organic breakfasts were delicious (try the fresh fruit crepes). Aquinnah was our favorite part of the Vineyard, with its magical light and its openness of sea and sky. We're definitely going back.
reviews.title: Warm welcome, beautiful rooms, stunning location
Quirky, magical, breathtaking views, relaxed vibe
reviews.text: Short, beautiful walk to best beach on the island. This eclectic inn with breathtaking views is one of the last vestiges of what island hospitality used to be. The end-of-island sea breezes eliminate the need for summer air conditioning while efficient passive solar construction and a Rumford fireplace in this 200-yr old house provide cosy comfort in winter. Charming innkeeper provides best breakfast with local produce - worth the visit. This is a Bohemian experience, more like a home stay than a hotel stay. Bring your whimsy.

Charming rooms, delicious organic breakfast fresh from the garden, short walk on a wooded path to the beach and the best view of the stars at night. Gorgeous ocean views and a warm, friendly innkeeper. Low key and completely relaxing. Pretty close to perfect.
reviews.title: Idyllic Martha's Vineyard retreat

aka: Duck Inn Chilmark, MA - Martha's Vineyard
